key_points: Grambling State University's band, the World Famed Tiger Marching Band, is set to perform at President-elect Joe Biden and Vice-President-elect Kamala Harris's inauguration festivities.
The performance is part of a virtual event entitled 'We Are One,' newly added to the inaugural schedule.
GSU President Rick Gallot emphasized the significance of their participation, especially in light of Kamala Harris being the first HBCU graduate to serve as Vice President.
Director of Bands, Dr. Nikole Roebuck, expressed honor in being invited to perform at the event.
The Tiger Marching Band has previously performed at presidential inaugurations for George W. Bush and Barack Obama. Bill Clinton has also performed with them at GSU.
The 'We Are One' event featuring the Tiger Marching Band is scheduled for Jan. 19, 2021, at 7:00 p.m. CST.
The band will participate in a Battle of the Bands segment, along with other notable groups from various universities.
The event will be available to watch on multiple platforms such as Urban One, BET, NBC Peacock TV, and others.
This inauguration marks the beginning of Joe Biden's presidency and Kamala Harris's vice presidency, with formal swearing-in on Jan. 20.
The article provides a link for more information on how to watch the inauguration events.
